Package ohos.aafwk.ability

Class Lifecycle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.aafwk.ability.Lifecycle

  • public class Lifecycle
extends Object
    Provides a class for you to observe the lifecycle of an Ability or AbilitySlice.

    Ability and AbilitySlice have their own lifecycle and dispatch their lifecycle states to Lifecycle for management. You can call the Lifecycle#getLifecycleState() method to obtain their current lifecycle state or call Lifecycle#addObserver(ILifecycleObserver) to add a lifecycle observer to observe lifecycle changes in real-time. This class allows you to implement lifecycle callbacks of Ability and AbilitySlice using methods from other classes. In this way, Ability and AbilitySlice can take only their own responsibilities, enabling a decoupled application architecture.

    You can call Ability#getLifecycle() and AbilitySlice#getLifecycle() to obtain Lifecycle objects.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    Ability.getLifecycle(), AbilitySlice.getLifecycle(), ILifecycleObserver
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITY

    • Method Detail

      • dispatchLifecycle

        public void dispatchLifecycle​(Lifecycle.Event event,
                              Intent intent)
        While Ability or AbilitySlice's lifecycle changes, dispatch lifecycle event.
        Parameters:
        event - Lifecycle state.
        Since:
        4

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver​(ILifecycleObserver observer)
        Adds a lifecycle observer.

        The observer will be notified of lifecycle changes.

        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the lifecycle observer, either LifecycleObserver or LifecycleStateObserver. The value cannot be null.
        See Also:
        LifecycleObserver, LifecycleStateObserver

      • removeObserver

        public void removeObserver​(ILifecycleObserver observer)
        Removes a lifecycle observer.

        You are advised to call this method if you no longer need to listen to lifecycle changes. This reduces the performance loss caused by observing lifecycle changes.

        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the lifecycle observer, either LifecycleObserver or LifecycleStateObserver. The value cannot be null.
        See Also:
        LifecycleObserver, LifecycleStateObserver

      • getLifecycleState

        public Lifecycle.Event getLifecycleState​()
        Obtains the current lifecycle event.

        Lifecycle events drive lifecycle state changes. Therefore, you are able to know the lifecycle state once you obtain the lifecycle event. For example, if the ON_ACTIVE event is received, the ability or ability slice is in the ACTIVE state; if the ON_FOREGROUND event is received, the ability or ability slice is changing from the BACKGROUND state to INACTIVE.

        Returns:
        Returns the current lifecycle event.
